channel.title: The Sci-Fi Control Room Podcast
channel.description: Hugo and Nebula award-winning science fiction author Kevin Vinter talks about the world of science fiction in the podcast. Join Kevin twice-a-month for interviews, book reviews, and readings from science fiction classics.

item.title: Control Room #4
item.description: Kevin looks at science fiction in the digital age and the impact on online media on science fiction magazines and fanzines. Kevin will also read the first half of his new novelette, Null Gateway.

item.title: Control Room #3
item.description: Kevin discusses the early days of the pulps with science fiction historian, critic, and author, Fredric Ogletree. Later, Kevin reads the winning entries from the limerick contest. This month's theme was: "Global Warming Limericks".

item.title: Control Room #2
item.description: Kevin reads an excerpt from his new novelette, The Wages of Sin, and a science essay, I am an Emergent Phenomenom. Kevin will also review the latests novel by K.D. Wilson and the new sf movie, Blaster Force (it stinks).

item.title: Control Room #1
item.description: Kevin Vinter introduces a new podcast with a packed program of readings and interviews from the world of science fiction. Kevin reads an extended excerpt from his Hugo awarding-winning novel, The Long Sleep and provides backstory on the writing of this sf classic. Join us for an interview with Otto Greene, editor of Escher Magazine. Finally we'll look at the recent WorldCon in Vancouver and applaud the winners.
